Arn.description: The ARN of the Contributor Insights rule, such as `arn:aws:cloudwatch:us-west-2:123456789012:insight-rule/MyInsightRuleName` .

RuleName.description: The name of the Contributor Insights rule.

description: Creates or updates a Contributor Insights rule. Rules evaluate log events in a CloudWatch Logs log group, enabling you to find contributor data for the log events in that log group. For more information, see [Using Contributor Insights to Analyze High-Cardinality Data](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/ContributorInsights.html) in the *Amazon CloudWatch User Guide* .

ApplyOnTransformedLogs.description: Determines whether the rules is evaluated on transformed versions of logs. Valid values are `TRUE` and `FALSE` .

RuleBody.description: The definition of the rule, as a JSON object. For details about the syntax, see [Contributor Insights Rule Syntax](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/ContributorInsights-RuleSyntax.html) in the *Amazon CloudWatch User Guide* .

RuleState.description: The current state of the rule. Valid values are `ENABLED` and `DISABLED` .

Tags.description:
A list of key-value pairs to associate with the Contributor Insights rule. You can associate as many as 50 tags with a rule.

Tags can help you organize and categorize your resources. For more information, see [Tagging Your Amazon CloudWatch Resources](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/CloudWatch-Tagging.html) .

To be able to associate tags with a rule, you must have the `cloudwatch:TagResource` permission in addition to the `cloudwatch:PutInsightRule` permission.
